com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager

Class BorderStyle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager.BorderStyle

  • public class BorderStyle
extends Object
    Holds the LineStyles for the top, right, bottom, and left borders of a PdfItem. For an equal border on all sides, use: 
    BorderStyle b = BorderStyle.of(color, width);
    For an unequal border, Java doesn't have named parameters, so this classes uses a builder pattern instead. This class works just like styles in CSS in terms of specifying one style, then overwriting it with another. This example sets all borders except to black and the default width, then removes the top border: 
    BorderStyle topBorderStyle = BorderStyle.builder().color(Color.BLACK)
                                                  .width(LineStyle.DEFAULT_WIDTH)
                                                  .top(null, 0).build();
    If neighboring cells in a cell-row have the same border, only one will be printed. If different, the left-border of the right cell will override. You have to manage your own top borders manually.
